page.title: 16ALL SAINTS CHURCH BRANSTON
page.content: Branston church is called All Saints and was built before the Norman conquest in 1066 although hardly any of the original church is left. On Christmas Day 1962 there was a fire that tragically damaged the church. The fire was first seen at about 8.15 pm and was not put out by Lincoln Fire Service for at least 6 hours.The fire damaged a lot of the church including the stained glass east window.New glass was designed by Mr Keith New whose work is also to be seen in Coventry Cathedral.In 1965 during the fitting of a new heating system, workmen discovered the vault of Sir Cecil Wray, whose descendants lived in Branston for many years.Coffins were found of Lord and Lady Vere Bertie, Dame Mary and Sir Cecil Wray, Henry and William Leslie Melville and 3 unknown infants.
